alert.note: Alert for Bell; Knox; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 3:37PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Bell, southwestern Knox and southeastern Whitley Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 337 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bryants Store, or 7 miles southwest of Barbourville, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Hubbs around 345 PM EDT. Goins and Myrick around 350 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Kayjay, Trosper, Wheeler, Frakes, Pearl, Davisburg, Ingram, Chenoa and Pruden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
